following attending father sermon st paul croſs service inthe quire ſhewed much humble devotion manifeſted princely gallantry juſts admired applauded people accompliſhments art war peace could behave unexpected growth strength king ſo many year slander ſuch induſtrious plot make odious contemptible raiſed admiration men fear credulous party given faith faction repreſented king guilty ſo much folly adverſaries counſels diſcovered end manifeſt maintain common liberty equally hateful tyranny hand acquire grandeur power might ſecure adminiſter luſts every publiſhed mr hambden anſwered one inquired expect king replied ſhould commit himſelf care others aſcribed fear ruine thoſe numerous family myriad people change government deſigned parliament muſt neceſſarily effect though argued cauſe exceeding bad ſo great part community utterly deſtroyed without abſolute neceſſity preſerving whole yet made inconſiderable addition king whoſe greateſt power built upon perſons nobleſt extract faireſt eſtates england could eaſily ſuſpect deveſted without abſolute overthrow law right wrong nevertheleſs feared invaſions king moſt undoubted right majeſty ſelf aſſaulted ſecurity private fortune yet valour therefore gathering ſcattered remains broken army march encourage thoſe whoſe faith changed condition laſt attempting relieve cheſter though beſet behind horſe wearied ſuch tedious reſtleſs perchance king abuſed thoſe grant miſinformation act made king james minority againſt biſhops yet unrepealed conceſſion would leave law king anſwered true told ſo whenever hear urged give anſwer ſay part ſuch engliſh proteſtants formerly ſent ireland two houſes impoſſibilitated ſtay longer neglect thoſe ſent thither ſhould better provided foreign force apparent army ſwarmed majeſty hath none whereas third impediment alledged prince head army weſt diver garriſons ſtill kept majeſtys obedience force scotland muſt much confeſſed yet peace therefore deſired ſuch perſonal treaty theſe officer state judge ſhall likewiſe extend kingdom scotland majeſty ſo fully clearly expreſſed intention deſires making happy wellgrounded peace perſon ſhall decline happineſs oppoſing ſo apparent way feb 26 mdcxlv vi anſwer former speaker houſe peer pro tempore communicated two houſes parliament weſtminſter commiſſioners parliament scotland charles r majeſty need make excuſe though ſent meſſages unto well know ought either ſtood upon punctilio honour private intereſt one already calld queſtion often ſending aſſuredly prejudgd peace concluded hath already offered therein departed many undoubted right nothing equally dear unto preſervation people majeſty paſſeth many ſcruples neglect delayes deſires give ſpeedy anſwer laſt meſſage majeſty belief doth well become long delay laſt utter impatience ſince good blood subject crie ſo much peace given court oxford 26 day february 1645 xxii oxford mar 23 mdcxlv vi concerning return houſes speaker houſe peer pro tempore communicated continuance unnatural war theſe kingdom rending dividing theſe kingdom ſo happily united ſent gracious meſſage unto houſes parliament commiſſioners parliament scotland expreſſing neceſſary cauſes coming oxford unto scotiſh army without intention make diviſion freedom right capacity ſettle true peace containing ſuch offer conceived would accepted general clauſe complying deſires impatient delay acquainted particular may give contentment majeſty doth earneſtly deſire propoſitions peace ſo often promiſed ſo much expected may ſpeedily ſent unto upon conſideration may apply himſelf give ſuch ſatisfaction may foundation firm peace better ſpeedy attaining thereunto majeſty doth propound may come london safety freedom honour reſolves comply houſes parliament every thing may moſt good subject perfect remains ſetling kingdom people happy condition likewiſe moſt confident according reiterated declaration ſolemn proteſtations zealous maintenance honour juſt lawful right majeſty deſires houſes parliament disburthen kingdom force garriſons power except ſuch theſe unhappy time maintained neceſſary defence ſafety kingdom ſo willing forthwith disband force garriſons within ſame incloſed order herewith ſent evidence upon theſe offer majeſty ſhall ſuch ſatisfaction may confident firm peace ſhall enſue thereon majeſty give order son prince preſent return newcaſtle tenth june 1646 truſty know left well taken away changed find upon diſcourſe ſaid commiſſioners ſo bound capacity either give reaſons demand bring give ear ſuch deſires majeſty propound impoſſible give ſuch preſent judgment confidence betwixt people alſo theſe doubt cleared theſe difficulty explained unto conceives deſtructive juſt regal power ſhall give full conſent theſe propoſitions ſtand likewiſe may make known ſuch reaſonable demand moſt aſſured much conducible peace good men deſire pray ſetling religion juſt privilege parliament freedom propriety subject majeſty aſſures never condeſcend unto abſolutely 1646 xxvii holdenby feb 17 mdcxlvi vii deſiring ſome chaplain speaker houſe peer pro tempore communicated two houſes parliament weſtminster since never diſſembled hid conſcience yet ſatisfied wherefore deſire leaſt two theſe reverend divine whoſe name ſet may free liberty wait upon diſcharging duty unto according function holdenby 17 february 1646 charles r b london b salisbury b anſwer unto ſo appearance ſending thing hear firſt coming hither notwithſtanding earl lauderdale hath london theſe ten day whoſe coming ſaid ſtop hath cauſed majeſty thus anticipate coming yet conſidering condition servant denied acceſs thoſe appointment election declared crime commiſſioners ſuch particularly permitted converſe majeſty letter ſhould given received may truly ſay caſe fit make conceſſions give anſwers ſince maſter theſe ordinary action undoubted right freeborn man mean ſoever birth certainly would ſtill ſilent subject condition much mended prefer ſuch right underſtanding betwixt parliament kingdom may make firm laſting peace dominion particular earthly bleſſing therefore majeſty hath diligently imployed utmoſt endeavour diver month paſt ſo inform underſtanding ſatisfie conſcience might able give ſuch anſwers propoſitions would moſt conformable parliament ingenuouſly profeſſes notwithſtanding pain hath taken therein nature ſome appears ſuch unto without diſclaiming reaſon god hath given judge good people without putting greateſt violence upon conſcience cannot give conſent yet majeſty may appear world deſirous give full ſatisfaction hath thought fit hereby expreſs readineſs grant may willingneſs receive perſonally two houſes weſtminſter ſhall approve thereof ſuch information reſt may beſt convince judgement ſatisfie thoſe doubt yet clear unto deſiring alſo conſider majeſty intended wind himſelf theſe trouble indirect mean eaſie readily conſent hath ſhall propoſed unto afterwards chuſe time break alledging forced conceſſions kept ſurely might incur hard cenſure indifferent men maxim kind guide majeſtys action freely clearly avows hold unlawful man moſt baſe king recede promiſes obtained force reſtraint wherefore majeſty rejecting thoſe act eſteems unworthy even paſſing might well inſiſt upon point honour reſpect preſent condition thus anſwers firſt propoſition upon majeſtys coming london heartily joyn ſhall concern honour two kingdom aſſembly state scotland commiſſioners deputy either kingdom particularly thoſe thing deſired propoſition upon confidence reſpectively ſame tenderneſs look upon thoſe thing concern without violation conſcience honour ſo neither agree others conceiving many reſpects diſagreeable preſent condition affair formerly preſented unto deſtructive main principal intereſts army thoſe whoſe affection concur majeſty ſeen propoſals army commiſſioners two houſes reſiding treated order clearing ſecuring right liberty kingdom ſetling juſt laſting peace propoſals conceives two houſes ſtrangers charles r liberty time hath eſpecially common theme deſire men common reaſon ſhews king leſs ſhould endure captivity yet call god world witneſs patience endured tedious reſtraint ſo long hope ſort suffering might conduce peace kingdom hindring effuſion bloud willingly undergo finding certain proof continued patience would turn perſonal ruine likewiſe much prejudice furtherance publick good thought bound well natural political obligation ſeek safety retiring ſelf ſome time publick view friend enemy appeal indifferent men judge juſt cauſe free ſelf hand thoſe change principle condition aſhamed openly intend deſtruction nobility taking away negative voice leveller doctrine rather countenanced puniſhed intention perſon changing putting ſtrict guard upon diſcharging moſt thoſe ſervants mine formerly willingly admitted wait upon ſufficiently declare would retirement miſinterpreted ſhall earneſtly unceſſantly endeavour ſetling ſafe wellgrounded peace whereever ſhall much may without effuſion chriſtian blood many time deſired preſt heard yet ear given reaſonable man think according ordinary courſe affair ſetled peace without god bleſs thoſe refuſe hear king surely nay muſt add beſides concern ſelf unleſs chief intereſts hearing likewiſe juſt ſatisfaction given unto wit presbyterian independent army thoſe adhered even scot ſay cannot ſpeak miracle opinion ſinful preſumption ſuch caſes expect truſt ſafe laſting peace cannot deny perſonal ſecurity urgent cauſe retirement ſo take god witneſs publick peace leſs mine eye find better way expreſs profeſsion know wiſer may deſiring urging chief intereſts may heard end may juſt ſatisfaction example army reſt though neceſſary yet ſuppoſe difficult content ought judgment enjoy liberty conſciences act oblivion indemnity ſhould extend reſt subject arrears ſhould ſpeedily duly paid undertake ſo may heard hindred uſing ſuch lawful honeſt mean ſhall chuſe conclude let heard freedom honour safety ſhall inſtantly break cloud retirement ſhew ſelf really pater patriae hampton court novemb 11 1647 xxxii iſle wight november 17 mdcxlvii perſonal treaty particular conceſſions speaker houſe peer pro tempore communicated enforced go thence likewiſe conſtant endeavour ſetling ſafe wellgrounded peace whereſoever ſhould place conceives himſelf much freedom security formerly think neceſſary making good profeſſions alſo 22 mdcxliv v dear heart since laſt choquen mean writing little new matter progreſs treaty theſe encloſed paper give thee full accompt thou ſooner london thou haſt reaſon wonder conſidering length uncertainty way forced ſend reſpect buſineſs ſelf believe thou wilt approve choice treater propoſitions differ nothing ſubſtance little word thoſe laſt wherefore need ſay nothing inſtructions yet made next hope ſend upon whole matter deſire thee ſhew queen miniſters improbability preſent treaty ſhould produce peace conſidering great ſtrange difference contrariety ground betwixt rebel propoſitions mine cannot alter mine ever hope prevail force little aſſiſtance thy mean ſoon make confident ever could put defenſive reaſonable ſum money would would eaſily brought reaſon concerning interferings oxford deſire thee ſuſpend thy judgement believe partial relation come thee ſhall ſend ſome may truſt word mouth much trouble u ſet paper copy wife 22 jan 1644 xxiii queen oxford jan 30 mdcxliv v dear heart sunday laſt received three letter thee one duplicate 30 decemb another 6 jan laſt 14 jan even one petit come duplicate laſt wherein infinitely joy expreſſions thy confident love ſo muſt extreamly wonder pretend friend cauſe believe thou wouldſt mention information ſide invent ſuch lye thou haſt ill office done thy care aſſiſtance hath leaſt ſuſpected ſo far truth juſt contrary true proteſt god never heard thee ſpoken greateſt expreſſions eſtimation thy love particularly thy diligent care aſſiſtance confident branch root knavery digging bare ſuſpicion indeed find fault thee ſhould taking ſo much care thine health aſſiſtance leaſt giving ſo often account deſire theſe three laſt making mention thy ſelf treaty begin day deſire thee confident ſhall never make peace abandoning friend ſuch one ſtand honour safety ſay becauſe knowing thy love ſure thou muſt believe make others likewiſe confident ſend thee herewith direction commiſſioners came ſelf without others maſters brother ſhall 50000 l procure liberty king spain marriage betwixt son charles maſters eldeſt daughter firſt freely undertaken give ſuch anſwer ſhall ſignifie nothing deſire thee give much sea wife 30 jan 1644 5 legge direction uxbridge commiſſioners firſt concerning religion government church ſuppoſe chief queſtion wherein two thing conſidered conſcience policy firſt muſt declare unto cannot yield change government biſhops fully concur moſt general opinion chriſtians age beſt likewiſe hold ſelf particularly bound oath took coronation alter government church found church patrimony cannot ſuffer diminution alienation without peradventure sacriledge likewiſe contrary coronation oath whatſoever ſhall offered rectifying abuſes crept yet eaſe tender conſciences ſo endamage foundation content hear ready give gracious anſwer thereunto ſecond king duty protect church ſo church aſſiſt king maintenance juſt authority wherefore predeceſſors always careful eſpecially ſince reformation keep dependency clergy entirely upon crown without ſcarcely ſit faſt upon king head therefore muſt nothing change leſſen neceſſary dependency next concerning militia conſcience certainly fitteſt ſubject king quarrel without kingly power ſhadow therefore upon mean quitted maintained according ancient known law land yet becauſe attain ſo much wiſhed peace good men manner neceſſary ſufficient real ſecurity given performance ſhall agreed upon permit either leaving ſtrong town military force rebel poſſeſſion article performed give ſuch aſſurance performance condition ſhall judge queen oxford feb 15 25 mdcxliv v dear heart 20 expectation expreſs thee find thine 4 febr good news likewiſe thou art well ſatisfied diligence writing treaty every day leſs hope produce peace abſolutely promiſe thee one ſhall ſuch ſhall invite thy return avow without thy company neither peace comfort within ſelf limited day treating almoſt expired without leaſt agreement upon one article wherefore ſent enlargement day whole treaty may laid open world aſſure thee thou needeſt doubt iſſue treaty commiſſioners ſo well choſen though ſay neither threatned diſputed ground given upon word according little note thou ſo well remembreſt obedience judgment concur confeſs ſome reſpects thou haſt reaſon bid beware going ſoon london indeed ſome amongſt u greater mind way fit perſwaſion percy one chief ſhortly like ſee thee ſaid enough ſhew thee truſted believed thee concerning proceeding ſhort little appearance summer hotteſt war hath yet confident making peace ſhall ever ſhew conſtancy oxford mar 5 mdcxliv v dear heart come paſs foreſaw fruitleſs end preſent peace treaty ſtill confident ſhall find good effect beſides commiſſioners offered ſay fullmeaſured reaſon rebel ſtucken rigidly demand dare ſay much though taken priſoner ſo aſſuredly breach light foully upon likewiſe time diſcovered ſhall make evidently appear world engliſh rebel whether baſely ignorantly great difference much lie tranſmitted command ireland crown england scot beſides reflection upon theſe rebel clearly ſhew reformation church chief much leſs end scotch rebellion preſumption piety ſo truſt good cauſe uſe lawful mean maintain thought one mean furniſh thee aſſiſtance hitherto thou haſt give thee power promiſe name thou thinkeſt moſt fit take away penal law againſt roman catholicks england ſoon god ſhall make able ſo mean favour may ſo powerful aſſiſtance may deſerve ſo great favour enable thou ask call aſſiſtance anſwer thou knoweſt may done eaſily ſeen deſerve ſo eſteemed need tell thee ſecrecy buſineſs requires yet ſay greateſt point confidence expreſs thee thanks truſt thee thing elſe thing difference opinion betwixt u yet know thou wilt make good bargain even truſting thee though concern religion thou wert proteſtant viſible good affair ſo much depending ſo fully inſtructed bearer pooly ſay thee herewith ſend thee new cypher aſſuring thee none hath ſhall copy ſelf end mutinous motion ſay mungrel parliament chief cauſers may juſtly expect chidden thee ſuffered thee vexed wilmot already percy way suſſex within day taking journey thee know thou careſt little trouble free great inconvenience yet muſt tell thee knew perfect ſtedineſs thy love might reaſonably apprehend repair thee would rather prove change end villanies cannot deny confidence thee ſome cauſe permiſſive trouble thee received thine third march thou putteſt hope aſſiſtance men money little expreſſion thy love becauſe buſineſs feſtivals troubleſome thee ſee aſſemblies country agreeable thee welcome circumſtance yet cannot find fault omiſſion moſt thy latter diſpatches nothing concerning thy health though confeſs news good news yet ſo ſatisfied without perfect aſſurance hope thou wilt letter farewel sweet heart god ſend good news thee wife may 14 1645 xxxvii queen daintry sunday 9 june dear heart oxford free hope come ſooner thee otherwiſe could expected make believe good news ſtale ſhort since taking leiceſter marching hither relieve oxford made rebel raiſe ſiege could come near quarter twice beaten garriſon loſt four hundred men aſſault boſtolhouſe firſt thought would fought marched far brackly ſince gone aſide brickhill ſo believe weaker thought whether diſtractions certainly great fairfax brown cudgel men cromwell likewiſe blow together captain ſlain waſting men ſay beſides goring hath given great defeat weſtern rebel yet know particular wherefore may without much ſanguine affirm ſince rebellion affair never ſo fair hopeful way though among ſelves want folly needleſs ſure tedious tell thee ſuch confident ſhall harm much trouble yet muſt tell thee thy letter fitzwilliams aſſuring thy perfect recovery thy wonted kindneſs make capable taking contentment theſe good ſucceſſes diver men propoſe ſeveral recompences themſelves pain hazard rebellion ſo thy company reward expect wiſh wife 9 june 1645 xxxviii prince rupert caerdiffe aug 3 mdcxlv c r nephew occaſioned letter duke richmond ſhewed yeſterday firſt aſſure ever careful advertiſe reſolutions ſo ſoon taken enjoyned ſilence ſecret fault thought one ſure ought ſo opinion buſineſs counſel thereupon quarrel defence religion crown friend full reaſon advice confeſs ſpeaking either meer souldier stateſman muſt ſay probability ruine yet chriſtian muſt tell god ſuffer rebel traitor proſper cauſe overthrown whatſoever perſonal puniſhment ſhall pleaſe inflict upon muſt make repine much leſs give quarrel little queſtion compoſition time nothing elſe ſubmiſſion grace god reſolved againſt whatſoever coſt know obligation conſcience honour neither abandon god cauſe injure succeſſors forſake friend indeed cannot flatter ſelf expectation good ſucceſs end day honour good conſcience obligeth continue endeavour deſpairing god may yet due time avenge cauſe though muſt aver friend ſtay time muſt expect reſolve either die good cauſe worſe live miſerable maintaining violence inſulting rebel make thus truly impartially ſtated caſe unto plainly told reſolutions grace god alter neither lightly ſuddenly grounded earneſtly deſire wiſe hearken treaty aſſuring low offered name vxbridge confeſſing great miracle ſhould agree ſo much reaſon ſhould within month ſame condition immediately battel naſeby therefore god ſake let u flatter ſelves theſe conceit believe imagination deſirous treaty loſe ſo much ſooner wherefore love whatſoever already done apply diſcourſe hereafter according reſolution judgement iriſh aſſure ſhall cheat poſſible may cozen themſelves aſſured refuſed engliſh grant iriſh rebel never truſting kind people nation ſoever ſee action ſending ormond ſuch diſpatch ſure pleaſe honeſt men copy whereof next opportunity ſhall laſtly confident would put ſelf trouble long letter great eſtimation full confidence friendſhip caerdiffe august 3 1645 c r xxxix secretary nicholas caerdiffe aug 4 mdcxlv nicholas commanded fellowsecretary give full account well majeſty hath declared ratified ceſſation ſhall proceed treaty beginning firſt propoſition majeſtys behalf concerning majeſtys revenue magazine town fort ship thereunto make anſwer ſhall declare two houſes parliament made uſe majeſtys revenue ſmall proportion good part hath employed maintenance majeſtys child according allowance eſtabliſhed himſelf ſatisfie ſhall remain due majeſty thoſe sum received majeſtys revenue ſhall leave ſame majeſty time come likewiſe ſhall propound majeſty reſtore hath taken uſe upon bill aſſigned purpoſes ſeveral act parliament proviſion made war ireland remove garriſons town fort hand wherein garriſons theſe trouble ſlight fortification made ſince time town fort agreed part ſhall continue ſame condition thoſe garriſons ſhall renewed fortification repaired would far greater advantage ſmall number subject concern caſe much otherwiſe expreſt majeſtys anſwer whereas charged give leaſt admiſſion liberty freedom trade ceſſation truth grant fully benefit subject even time war majeſty preſſing people good doth therein deſire little beneficial subject exceeding advantagious majeſty ſupplying army many neceſſaries making quarter ſtaple ſuch commodity may vented adjacent county ſo draw mony thither whereby inhabitant better enabled loan contribution ſupport majeſtys army majeſtys army may receive much advantage army much danger ſuch freedom ſhould granted thoſe place ſo probability army raiſed lord common ſhall return commodity supply thence may uſeful conceive treaty ceſſation thoſe demand cannot thought reaſonable indifferent equally advantagious party given interruption trade kingdom relation ſupply contrary army reaſon war requires ſo beſeech majeſty conſider whether souldiers robbed carrier ſeveral part hath ſuch reaſon ship place oxford souldiers muſt committed run colour refuſe duty army man ſhall committed ſubmitting neceſſary ſupplies mony yielded majeſtys ſenſe ſhall diſabled reſtrain ſupplies enemy govern maintain ſhall committed according known law land proceſs law rather majeſty ſo interrupt limitation known law though lay ſtreight bond upon two houſes yet leaf general much liberty hath denied majeſty theſe known law give power two houſes parliament raiſe arm ſo conſequently general cannot exerciſe martial law thoſe caſes unlike affirmed general conſtituted majeſtys commiſſion power ſame known law article ſpecious ſhew liberty law would altogether diſable defend liberty law would produce majeſty abſolute victory submiſſion pretence ceſſation treaty v neceſſity inevitable part enforced defenſive war unhappy breach majeſty therein warranted law god man muſt need follow ſame law enabled raiſe mean ſupport war therefore till ſhall pleaſe god incline majeſty afford ſuch peace may ſecure cannot relinquiſh power laying tax upon thoſe ought joyn defence neceſſary way levying thoſe tax upon caſe refuſal otherwiſe army muſt need diſſolved majeſty ſhall conſent disband army cauſe war taken away intend reſtrain quarter either army force abbingdon may remove banbury force henly may remove ailesbury place within quarter army reſpectively falkland committee anſwer concerning removal quarter mar 31 1643 anſwer majeſtys queſtion upon third article ceſſation humbly conceive intended reſtrain quarter army reſpectively ſo come nearer quarter army force abbingdon may remove banbury force henly may remove ailesbury place within quarter army reſpectively ſo force either army reſpectively come nearer quarter army ſhall upon day agreed ceſſation begin northumberland john holland b whitelocke next reſolved c friday laſt queſtion ſhall taken incluſive joh brown cler parliamentorum april 4 majeſtys meſſage concerning ceſſation charles r majeſty hath ſpent time ſince committee two houſes parliament came hither willing hath four day allowed expedite treaty ſelf free diligent diſquiſition particular comprized thoſe two firſt article intent hath upon ceſſation think ſo neceſſary ſo much deſires ſince laſt meſſage concerning ſame came committee themſelves cannot obſerve though concluſion could made within two day time limited much ſtrictneſs buſineſs ſo great moment word expreſſions eſquire sir robert talbot baronet sir richard barnewell baronet torlogh oneale geffry brown ever macgennis john walſh eſquires part article remaining ſaid marqueſs ormond put hand seal day year inſtrument bearing date theſe preſents behalf authority roman catholicks kingdom freely given unto majeſty sum thirty thouſand pound sterling wherein time manner payment expreſſed therefore hereby agree ſame ſhall paid manner following viz 5000 pound within one month next date theſe preſents one half money half good merchantable beef four ten year old rate 30 pound ſcore city dublin 5000 pound within one month next ſaid firſt month one half money half beef aforeſaid like rate city dublin aforeſaid alſo within two month next 5000 pound whereof one half beef aforeſaid like rate half money one 5000 pound laſt february next sum 10000 pound laſt payment ſaid thirty thouſand pound laſt day may next ſhall year 1644 hereby agree 800 pound ſhall paid majeſtys uſe lord justice ſhall appoint garriſon naas within two month next enſuing one half one month end next date hereof half end one month next firſt month payment money ſave eight hundred pound ſhall paid dublin reſt beef ſave ſaid much majesty army hath already ſuffered want relief england though ſame often preſſed importuned moſt gracious majeſty hath left nothing unattempted might conduce ſupport maintenance unto common thereof warn good subject longer misled vote order pretended ordinance one houſes reaſon member enjoy freedom liberty parliament appears ſeveral inſtances force violence courſe proceeding mentioned ſelves bound let majeſty know ſeeing continuance parliament ſettled law law kingdom majesty hath ſworn maintain ſworn allegiance majesty theſe obligation reciprocal muſt duty accordingly reſolved life fortune defend preſerve right full power parliament beſeech majeſty aſſured majeſtys royal hearty concurrence u herein moſt effectual ready mean procuring firm laſting peace majeſtys dominion begetting perfect underſtanding majeſty people without majeſtys moſt earneſt profeſſions moſt real intention concerning ſame muſt neceſſarily fruſtrated caſe majeſtys three kingdom ſhould reaſon parliament england weſtminſter 9 march 1643 gray wark speaker houſe peer parliament pro tempore william lenthall speaker common houſe parliament whoſoever conſiders ſhould letter subject might well think unbeſeeming language call majeſtys earneſt endeavour peace profeſſions feigned pretence moſt real intention much menacing language majeſty cannot leaſt laſt sufferer expreſſions subject arm ȝeires eſtaites parliament preſentlie conveined vertew laſt act laſt parliament haldin majeſty thrie eſtaites anno 1641 conſiddering kingdome efter uther meanes ſupplicationnes remonſtrances ſending commiſſionaris majeſty bein uſed without ſucceſſe enter ſolemne league covenant kingdom parliament england reformationne defence religionne honor happines king peace safety thrie kingdom scotland england ireland ane treattie aggried upon ane armie force raiſed ſent yi kingdom theſe endis quhairupone conventionne eſtaites kingdome nynt jannuary laſt deſirous uſe good lawful meanes treuth peace might eſtabliſhed majeſtys dominion ſuch bleſſed pacificationne betwixt majeſty subjectis might ſerve moſt majeſtys trew honor safety happines people granted commiſſione johne erle lowdonne heigh chancellor scotland johne lord maitland ȝit england sir archibald johneſtounne warieſtounne ane lordis seſſionne maiſter robert barclay england repaire england powar thame twa yame endeavoure effectuating ye foirſaides endis conforme commiſſione inſtructiones givin thame commiſſione dait foirſaid proportis lyke ſaides johne lord maitland sir archibald johneſtounne maiſter robert barclay evir ſinceattendit england diſcharge foirſaid commiſſione qunhil lately sir archibald johneſtounne returned ſome propoſitiones prepaired committie kingdomes preſented eſtaites scotland howſs parliament england thame reviſed conſidderit mutual advyſe kingdomes preſented ane ſafe weillgrounded peace qwhilkies propoſitiones ar reviſed conſidderit advyſed eſtaites parliament conveined ſenſe reſultis drawin yrupone whiche commiſſione endure comming commiſſionaris underwrittin heirewith alſo conſidderin endis whilk ſamen granted ar ȝit effectuate propoſitiones ye eſtaites thair reſultis yrupone ar returned toye parliament england thairfore eſtaites parliament thir preſentis give full powar commiſſione ſaid johne erle lowdonne lord heigh chancellor yi kingdome archibald marqueis arg yle johne lord balmerino nobility sir archibald johneſtounne warieſtounne sir charles erskyne cambuskenneth maiſter george dundas maner barrones sir johne smyth grottel proveiſt edenburgh hew kennedy burges air maſter robert barclay burrowes thrie eſtaites yi kingdom johne lord maitland ſupernumerarie commiſſione thrie mae haill number thair ane ilk eſtaite commiſſionaris eſtaites parliament kingdome repaire kingdome england ſick ar thair already powar thameor thrie mae whole number thair ane ilk eſtaite endeavour effectuating ye foirſaides endis concluding propoſitions eſtaites thaire reſults thairupon ſuch uyr materis concerning good bothe kingdomes ar ſall time time committed unto thame eſtaites yi kingdome committies thairof according inſtructiones givin givin commiſſionaris abovenameit thair quorum effect eſtaites ordeanes johne erle lowdonne chancellor johne lord balmerino sir archibald johneſtounne warieſtounne sir charles erskyne cambuskenneth hew kennedy repaire diligence kingdome england eſſect rehearſit conforme commiſſione inſtructiones alſo eſtaites ordeanes ye ſaides archibald marqueis argyle maiſter george dundas maner sir johne smyth proveiſt edenburgh repaire ye kingdome england ſick conveniencie occaſione ye buſineſſe ſhall require ſall commandit ather committie parliament heir scotland committie army england ordeanes thame joyne remanent commiſſionaris effect abovementionat conforme commiſſione inſtructiones givin givin commiſſionaris thair quorum thairanent eſtaites kingdom committies yrof eſtaites parliament thir preſentis haldis ſall halde firme ſtable ſumme ever thinges commiſſionaris abovenamit thrie mae thame ſall conforme commiſſionne inſtructionnes givin givin thame eſtractit furthe buikes parliament sir alexander underſtood concluded either ſide delivered writing according lordſhips begun declare ſhall delivered writing upon propoſition upon part propoſition binding prejudicial either party treaty break upon propoſition part propoſition anſwer 31 jan ſhall deliver demand anſwers writing deſire lordſhips like king commiſſioners reply 1 february deſire full anſwer paper nothing ſhall taken agreed upon put one mr love thurſday marketday firſt day meeting many paſſages scandalous majeſtys perſon derogatory honour ſtirring people againſt treaty incenſing againſt u telling come heart full blood great diſtance treaty peace heaven hell word effect diver seditious paſſages againſt majeſty treaty know majeſtys hearty deſire happy wellgrounded peace ſuch may god honour good subject well himſelf entruſted commiſſion come clear intention ſerve according conſciences beſt judgment preached quarter ſafe conduct deſire lordſhips conſider much may reflect upon safety much may prejudice blaſt bleſſed hope treaty juſt offence diſtruſt may beget majeſty therefore deſire juſtice againſt man may exemplary puniſhment anſwer 31 jan paper delivered lordſhips day concerning information received ſeveral scandalous paſſages preached sermon vxbridge church one maſter love return anſwer ſaid maſter love none retinue came hither privity conceive moſt reaſonable agreeable buſineſs upon juſt occaſions offence either part avoided hath deſire ſo ſhall endeavour take beſt care prevent prejudice upon preſent treaty may blaſt bleſſed hope thereof may beget juſt offence diſtruſt majeſty ſhall tender safety lordſhips perſons according ſafe conduct ſhall repreſent lordſhips paper concerning buſineſs lordſhips ſo deſire unto lord common aſſembled parliament england proceed therein according juſtice king commiſſioners reply 1 february vve inſiſt upon former deſire concerning sermon preached mr love muſt refer way juſtice lordſhips lordſhips ſatisfied ſuch word charged ſpoken ready produce ſubmit otherwiſe peace main end pretence alteration cannot eſtabliſhed therefore earneſtly beſeech lordſhips conſider weigh whether without ſhaking foundation much better agreeable chriſtian prudence puniſhment ſecurity majeſty war act oblivion deſired paſſed whereby majeſtys subject kingdom would put one ſame condition ſame protection ſome exception mentioned thoſe propoſitions commiſſioners ſeverally choſen memory theſe unnatural diviſions muſt need continued probably ſeverally named would acted dividedly according ſeveral intereſts war thereby might eaſily revived whereas ſcope propoſitions tendred take away occaſions future difference prevent raiſing arm ſettle firm durable peace lordſhips objection commiſſioners continue without limitation time although reaſonableneſs thereof hath ſufficiently manifeſted lordſhips yet moſt earneſt deſires peace propoſed lordſhips time ſeven year expreſſed paper delivered lordſhips 21ſt inſtant peculiar royal power lordſhips mention reſide majeſty concerning militia make peace war cannot admit thereof otherwiſe exerciſed authority majeſty houſes parliament england eſtates parliament scotland reſpectively neither commiſſioners thereunto 19 february king commiſſioners anſwer 18 february n 149 delivered paper 20 february vve already told lordſhips far ſatisfied alledged againſt majeſties power make ceſſation rebel ireland ceſſation could reduce war moſt confident neceſſities offered excuſes real ground ceſſation viſible thoſe kingdom whoſe advice majeſty ought reaſon follow whoſe intereſts moſt concerned would given jealouſies poſſible danger yet lordſhips inſiſt thoſe perſons entruſted ſhall nominated two houſes parliament england eſtates parliament scotland time great general unheardof truſt ſhall ſuch manner though ſeem limited ſeven year yet truth declaring thoſe ſeven year ſhall otherwiſe exerciſed majeſty two houſes parliament ſhall agree majeſty may thereby totally ever deveſted power sword without whereas two houſes parliament england juſt deep ſenſe great iminent danger true proteſtant religion regard great force papiſts prelate malignants adherent raiſed imployed againſt conſtant profeſſors engliſh commiſſioners auguſt 19 convention eſtates thereupon give power committee conſider debate engliſh commiſſioners propoſitions might added concluded whereby aſſiſtance deſired might made foot ſix hundred fifty horſe well armed horſed yet pleaſed god ſo diſappoint counſels ſtrength thoſe ſmall force lord marqueſs fighting men two thouſand five hundred foot five hundred horſe well armed rebel wherein ſlain three hundred many commander others quality diver taken priſoners amongſt thoſe priſoners colonel cullen native city colonel france departed thence came hither aſſiſt rebel lieutenantgeneral army province leimster rebel army totally routed defeated baggage munition ſeized majeſties force lodged night gained victory ſide twenty ſlain fight diver wounded great cauſe praiſe reſtrain true great cauſe heretofore reſtrain two houſes giving subject money u found difficulty obtain three four subſidies met raiſing ſo many million people cannot think themſelves well dealt u judging moſt immediate mean aboliſh ſo many horrid confuſions kingdom argument ſay ſhall ſuch perſonal treaty becauſe war ſtrong inducement ſuch treaty put end war secondly ſhould ſuch perſonal treaty loyalty soveraign indeed moſt part ſuch engliſh proteſtants formerly ſent ireland two houſes impoſſibilitated ſtay longer neglect thoſe ſent thither ſhould better provided forein force apparent army ſwarmed majeſty hath none whereas third impediment alledged prince head army weſt diver garriſons ſtill kept majeſties obedience force scotland muſt much confeſſed yet peace therefore deſired ſuch three kingdom doth inſtantly deſire anſwer ſaid former meſſages hath hitherto received none given court oxon 24 jan 1645 majesty meſſage houſes oxford jan 29 164546 speaker houſe peer pro tempore parliament reſt subject kingdom ſend declaration ſaid houſes containing whole truth buſineſs earl glamorgan made offer unto raiſe force kingdom ireland conduct england majeſties service commiſſion commiſſioners ſuch particularly permitted converſe majeſty letter ſhould given received may truly ſay caſe fit make conceſſions give anſwers ſince maſter thoſe ordinary action undoubted right freeborn man mean ſoever birth certainly would ſtill ſilent subject condition much mended prefer ſuch right underſtanding betwixt parliament kingdom may make firm laſting peace dominion particular earthly bleſſing therefore majeſty hath diligently employed utmoſt endeavour diver month paſt ſo inform underſtanding ſatisfie conſcience might able give ſuch anſwers propoſitions would moſt agreeable parliament ingenuouſly profeſſes withſtanding pain hath taken therein nature ſome appears ſuch unto without diſclaiming reaſon god hath given judge good people without putting greateſt violence upon conſcience cannot give conſent yet majeſty may appear world deſirous give full ſatisfaction hath thought fit hereby expreſs readineſs grant may willingneſs receive perſonally two houſes vveſtminster ſhall approve thereof ſuch information reſt may beſt convince judgment ſatisfie thoſe doubt yet clear unto deſiring alſo conſider majeſty intended wind himſelf theſe trouble indirect mean eaſie readily conſent hath ſhall propoſed unto afterwards chuſe time break alledging forcd conceſſions kept surely might incur hard cenſure ſome indifferent men maximes kind guide majeſties action freely clearly avows hold unlawful man moſt baſe king recede promiſes obtained force reſtraint wherefore majeſty onely rejecting thoſe act eſteems unworthy even paſſing might well inſiſt upon point honour reſpect preſent condition thus anſwers firſt propoſition upon majeſties coming london heartily joyn ſhall concern honour two kingdom aſſembly state scotland commiſſioners deputy either kingdom particularly thoſe thing deſired propoſition upon confidence reſpectively ſame tenderneſs look upon thoſe thing concern majeſties honour anſwer propoſitions concerning religion majeſty propoſeth ſatisfaction ſhall particularly informed ſaid penalty ſhall levied diſpoſed tenth majeſties anſwer hath always ready prevent practice papiſts therefore content paſs act parliament purpoſe alſo law againſt duly executed majeſty give conſent act due obſervation lord day ſuppreſſing innovation thoſe concerning preaching god word touching nonreſidence plurality majeſty yield ſuch act act ſhall requiſite raiſe money payment ſatisfying publick debt expecting alſo therein included propoſition touching militia though majeſty cannot conſent unto terminis propoſed becauſe thereby conceives wholly part power sword entruſted god law land protection government people thereby deveſting himſelf diſ inheriting poſterity right prerogative crown abſolutely neceſſary kingly office ſo weaken monarchy kingdom little name shadow remain yet onely ſecurity preſervation peace kingdom unhappy trouble due performance agreement concluded deſired majeſty always underſtood caſe hope herein miſtaken majeſty give abundant ſatisfaction end willing act parliament whole power militia sea land ſpace ten year hand ſuch perſons two houſes ſhall nominate giving power ſaid term change ſaid perſons ſubſtitute others place pleaſure afterwards return proper chanel time queen elizabeth king james bleſſed memory majeſty conjures two houſes parliament engliſhmen lover peace duty owe majeſty king bowel compaſſion fellowsubjects accept majeſties offer whereby joyful news peace may reſtored languiſhing kingdom majeſty grant like kingdom scotland deſired agree thing propounded touching conſerving peace betwixt two kingdom touching ireland thing agreed majeſty give satisfaction therein mutual declaration propoſed eſtabliſhed kingdom act parliament modification qualification branch follow propoſitions majeſty onely profeſſes doth ſufficiently underſtand able reconcile many thing contained well knoweth general act oblivion beſt bond peace inteſtine trouble wiſdom kingdom hath uſually happily age granted general pardon whereby numerous diſcontentments many perſons family otherwiſe expoſed ruine might become fewel new diſorders ſeeds future trouble majeſty therefore deſires two houſes parliament would ſeriouſly deſcend theſe conſiderations likewiſe tenderly look upon condition herein perpetual diſhonour muſt cleave ſhall thus abandon ſo many perſons condition fortune engaged doubt give reaſonable ſatisfaction kingdom given hamptoncourt ninth september 1647 majesty meſſage houſes left table hamptoncourt nov 11 1647 challes r liberty time hath eſpecially common theme deſire men common reaſon ſhews king leſs ſhould endure captivity yet call god world witneſs patience endured tedious reſtraint ſo long hope ſort suffering might conduce peace kingdom hindring effuſion blood willingly undergoe finding two certain proof continued patience would turn perſonal ruine likewiſe much prejudice furtherance publick good thought bound well natural political obligation ſeek safety retiring ſelf ſome time publick view friend enemy appeal indifferent men judge juſt cauſe free ſelf hand thoſe change principle condition aſhamed openly intend deſtruction nobility taking away negative voice leveller doctrine rather countenanced puniſhed intention perſon changing putting ſtrict guard upon diſcharging moſt thoſe servant mine formerly willingly admitetd wait upon ſufficiently declare would retirement miſinterpreted ſhall earneſtly unceſſantly endeavour ſetling ſafe wellgrounded peace whereever ſhall much may without effuſion chriſtian blood many time deſired preſt heard yet ear given reaſonable man think according ordinary courſe affair ſetled peace without god bleſs thoſe refuſe hear king surely nay muſt add beſides concern ſelf unleſs chief intereſts hearing likewiſe juſt ſatisfaction given unto wit presbyterian independants army thoſe adhered even scot ſay cannot ſpeak miracle opinion ſinful preſumption ſuch caſes expect truſt ſafe laſting peace cannot deny perſonal security urgent cauſe retirement ſo take god witneſs publick peace leſs eye find better way expreſs profeſſion know wiſer man may deſiring urging chief intereſts may heard end may juſt satisfaction example army reſt though neceſſary yet ſuppoſe difficult content ought judgment enjoy liberty conſciences act oblivion indemnity ſhould extend reſt subject arrears ſhould ſpeedily duly paid undertake ſo may heard hindred uſing ſuch lawful honeſt mean ſhall chuſe conclude let heard freedom honour safety ſhall inſtantly break cloud retirement ſhew ſelf really pater patriae charles r majeſty confident time two houſes parliament received meſſage left behind hamptoncourt eleventh month underſtood reaſons enforced go thence likewiſe conſtant endeavour ſetling ſafe wellgrounded peace whereſoever ſhould place conceives himſelf much freedom security formerly think neceſſary making good profeſſions alſo ſpeedy procuring peace theſe languiſhing diſtreſſed kingdom time offer ſuch ground two houſes effect upon due examination intereſts may beſt conduce thereunto becauſe religion beſt chiefeſt foundation peace majeſty begin particular aboliſhing archbiſhops four bill majeſty subject would caſt majeſty think unfit wiſh two houſes conſider well manner proceeding majeſty deſires perſonal treaty ſettling peace anſwer propoſe ſubject matter moſt eſſential part thereof firſt granted thing hardly credible poſterity wherefore majeſty declares neither deſire freed tedious irkſome condition life majeſty hath ſo long ſuffered apprehenſion may befall caſe two houſes ſhall afford perſonal treaty ſhall make change reſolution conſenting act till whole peace concluded yet intends give juſt reaſonable ſatisfaction particular preſented alſo make good conceſſions god juſtice reaping glory calamity robbd proſperity thou lord haſt made u ſee reſolutions future reforming always ſatisfie thy juſtice prevent thy vengeance former miſcarriages sin overlaid hope thou haſt taught u depend thy mercy forgive purpoſe amend thou haſt vindicated thy glory thy judgment haſt ſhewed u unſafe offend thee upon preſumptions afterwards pleaſe thee truſt thy mercy restore thoſe bleſſings u ſo much abuſed force thee deprive u want timely repentance ſins thou givest u cauſe repent thoſe remedy late apply yet repent calling laſt parliament becauſe lord upright intention thy majeſty king england might hereafter hang like mahomet tomb magnetick charm power priviledges two houſes aiery imagination regality believe ſurfeit much power ſome men greedily ſeized ſeek wholly crown ſhould never permit enjoy juſt neceſſary right point power laſt law reſolved thereby beſt protected honour juſtice due succeſſors forbid yield ſuch total alienation power civility duty leſs juſtice honour ſhould forbad asked although content eclipſe beam ſatisfie fear think muſt need ſcorched blinded ſhould ſhine full luſtre kingly power wherewith god law inveſted yet never conſent put sun soveraignty poſterity ſucceeding king whoſe juſt recovery right unjuſt uſurpations extortion ſhall never prejudiced obſtructed act mine indeed would injurious ſucceeding king subject deſire leave vineyard thy right hand hath planted dew heaven ſo long watered happy flouriſhing eſtate let bear infamous brand poſterity firſt chriſtian king kingdom ſhould conſent oppreſſion thy church father dwelleſt king king fillest heaven earth art fountain eternal life ſhadow death thou god art juſt inflicter death upon u merciful saviour u yea better u dead ſelves live thee living ſelves deprived thee make many bitter aggravation death man king opportunity advantage thy ſpecial grace comfort soul chriſtian thou lord wilt ſhall neither fear feel evil tho walk valley ſhadow death contend death work weak mortal man overcome grace thee alone art almighty immortal god saviour knoweſt die man make know paſs death life thee god tho die yet know thou redeemer liveſt ever tho thou ſlayest yet thou haſt incouraged trust thee eternal life withdraw thy favour better life far know near violent cruel death thy omniſcience god diſcovers ſo thy omnipotence defeat deſigns thoſe ſhall conſpire deſtruction ſhew goodneſs thy wickedneſs thou giveſt leave man pray cup may paſs thou hast taught chriſtian example chriſt add thine done yea lord let will one wholly reſolving mine thine let deſire life ſo great ſuffering thy either life death believe thou haſt forgiven error life ſo hope thou wilt ſave terror death make content leave world nothing may come really enjoy thee hast made chriſt unto life gain nnd death advantage tho deſtroyers forget duty thee yet thou lord forget merciful profit blood gaining kingdom loſe soul reſisted juſt power wholly uſurped turned againſt ſelf tho may deſerve yet let receive themſelves damnation thou madeſt thy son saviour many crucified ſuffered violently yet willingly let voice blood heard murtherers louder cry mine againſt prepare thy mercy due conviction sin let deceive damn soul fallacious pretenſions juſtice destroying conſcience unjuſt vſurpation power againſt chiefly tempts uſe extremity againſt lord thou knoweſt found mercy falſe ſo son thy deſtroying angel may paſs tho think kingdom earth little entertain yet let capacious kingdom thy infinite mercy laſt receive enemy reconciled thee blood ſame redeemer ſhall live far theſe ambitious deſires beget ſuch mortal enmity hand ſhall heavieſt cruelleſt upon let fall arm thy tender eternal mercy cut life miſerable moment may repayed thy everbleſſed eternity lord let thy servant
